TopicTitle: Undock from station, however can no longer control station

Articles.Content:
Hello

First of all this game is awesome, never thought orbital mechanics could be so fun!

I recently built my first orbiting space station (7 launches and 6 rendezvous). I docked my first ship to it and all went well, I then un-docked and re-entered the atmosphere to land. After that when I select the station I can no longer control it, SAS or gyro's anything.

The station is fully powered with plenty of RCS fuel, was working fine prior.

Can I regain control of that station?

Edited November 5, 2013 by dellcom1800
So you can't activate RCS either? OR you do activate RCS and it does nothing?

Correct I cannot active RCS or SAS stability. There are 2 primary pods the make up the station but its like I am not actually controlling from either of them. I cannot right-click them select control from here or anything either.

How is the electricity level of your station?

And It may sound stupid, but better check, if the pods are kerbal pod do you have at least one kerbal in it?

A screen is always useful too.

You need a source of electricity.

You need a command pod.

We need a photo.

Also, make sure you are in the proper "thrust" mode. ex. docking

Edited October 19, 2013 by Gus

I will try and get a pic in a bit. There is plenty of electricity and the batteries are fully charged. There are 2 kerbal pods which was fine, but after i did my ship docking i put a kerbal in one. Then i moved him back to the ship and un-docked and de-orbited. There are no other command modules.

@gus and @UbioZur I think that could be the problem! Now that you bring it up I did decouple a maneuvering rocket I left there which had a command module. I can launch another module with one attached.

I'll let you know if that was it. Thank you guys for the quick response.
Yup that was the problem. Thanks again!
